result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joeseph R. WILES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joeseph R. WILES

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order to Dismiss.  
Ordering count 2 of the action dismissed without prejudice because the defendant successfully completed the Deferred Judgment Agreement.

Motion to Dismiss.
The defendant successfully completed the Deferred Judgment Agreement.

NO CONTEST pleas entered to counts 2 and 3, stalking and bail jumping.
The Court accepts the pleas, finds the defendant guilty and convicts him of count 3, bail jumping.  The Court withholds entry of judgment of conviction on count 2, pursuant to a Deferred Judgment Agreement.
State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted.
On count 2, stalking, the Court approves the Deferred Judgment Agreement for a period of thirty (30) months.
Review date:  05-14-2017
On count 3, bail jumping, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for sixty (60) days, under the Huber Law, commencing on 12-02-14 by 6:00 p.m.
Defendant has credit for 4 days.  (08-21-14 to 08-25-14)
$443.00 court costs imposed.  
$350.00 cash bail from 14 CM 329 applied.  $93.00 balance is to be applied from the $2,100.00 cash bail on this case.  
$2,007.00 balance of cash bail is ordered returned to Gary Brennan at 815 Manitou Drive, Manitowoc, WI by check instruction no: CR 163.
The Court modifies the cash bail  to $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition of no contact with Nicole Brey.  Bail furnished.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Deferred Judgment Agreement.
Recognizance bond.
Check instruction form.
Minutes.
Plea date is set for 11-14-14 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-17-14 at 11:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Authorization to Appear and Act; Demand for Discovery and Inspection; Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-08-14 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Joeseph R. WILES
Current: 925 Hwy 310, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 08-25-2014)
Prior: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States
Memo regarding defendant's firearms being turned over to MTPD.

$2,100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Notice of Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.
Re:  Nicole R. Brey, between 06-23-14 through 08-20-14.

Defendant in custody.   
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of intimidate victim, stalking, and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-25-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,100.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Nicole Brey except as inadvertant, incidental contact at work, no contact with her residence at 1602 Madison Street, Manitowoc, WI.  No possession of any firearms and they must be turned over to the Manitowoc City Police Department before any release from custody.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  
Probable cause Statement and Judicial Determination.  
Minutes.
